revised_title: Evolution of Passive Continental Margins: Insights from Deep Drilling off Northwest Africa
tldr: This article discusses the geological setting and results of deep drilling off northwest Africa, focusing on the evolution of passive continental margins. The authors describe the Mesozoic history of the basins, the Cainozoic changes in paleo-oceanographic conditions, and the tectonic activity in the region. The study provides insights into the formation and development of the eastern Atlantic margin.
